brief_description: Identify NK cell ligands regulated by influenza A virus infection using a monocyte-NK co-culture system and a Helios Mass cytometer. Two major ligands we found that contributed to the variance between the two strains were CD54 and CD112.
brief_title: Profiling of NK cell ligands on moocytes infected with Influenza A virus
condition_studied: Influenza A virus regulation of NK cell ligands
description: Goal for the study was to identify NK cell ligands regulated by influenza A virus infection. More specifically we asked whether A/California/07/2009 or A/Victoria/361/2011 virus influenza A viruses differentially modulate NK cell ligands. Using 9 healthy Stanford blood bank donors, we isolated monocytes and NK cells. Monocytes were infected for 1 hr, followed by co-culture with NK cells for 6 or 23 hr hours. Brefeldin adn Monenin were added for the last 4 hours. They were then stained with a CyTOF panel and run on a Helios Mass cytometer. Two major ligands we found that contributed to the variance between the two strains were CD54 and CD112.
hypothesis: Influenza A viruses differentially regulate NK cell ligands
objectives: Identify NK cell ligands regulated by influenza A viral infection
official_title: Profiling of NK cell ligands on moocytes infected with mock, A/California/07/2009 or A/Victoria/361/2011 virus

arm.description: 9 healthy donors from the Stanford Blood Bank (SBB)
arm.name: Blood Bank Donors

pubmed.title: Differential Induction of IFN-? and Modulation of CD112 and CD54 Expression Govern the Magnitude of NK Cell IFN-? Response to Influenza A Viruses.

program.program_name: Cooperative Centers on Human Immunology RFA-AI-17-040
program.contract_name: Adaptive And Innate Immunity, Memory And Repertoire In Vaccination And Infection

program.program_name: NIH Director's New Innovator Award Program (DP2) 2013
program.contract_name: Harnessing Natural Killer Cell Memory To Fight Viruses
